blocks.content: Julien Bek was born in France and grew up in Paris. He later attended the University of Cambridge in the United Kingdom, where he completed his higher education. Details regarding his early family background and formative years have not been publicly disclosed. Bek’s exposure to both French and British educational systems contributed to shaping his international outlook, which later influenced his career in venture capital.

references.title: Julien Bek – Forbes
references.author: Forbes Staff

blocks.content: Julien Bek is a venture capitalist focusing on seed and early-stage investments, and is a partner at Sequoia Capital's London office. He joined Sequoia Capital as part of the firm's expansion into Europe, where he has played a key role in building out its presence and supporting European founders. Bek is noted for his activity in enterprise software and AI, backing startups such as Dust, Rillet, and Lemni. He has led or participated in investments in companies including Dust—an AI enterprise assistant platform—participating in their seed and subsequent rounds, and Rillet, an AI platform for automating general-ledger systems. Additionally, Bek has supported Lemni, a company developing AI agents for businesses, and Magentic, a British AI startup automating enterprise supply chains.

Prior to joining Sequoia, Bek worked at Accel, another leading venture capital firm, where he developed expertise in European early-stage investments. His background also includes experience in financial technology, with involvement in the early rounds of investment for companies such as Revolut.

Bek's investments span across enterprise SaaS, AI, and fintech verticals. He is a frequent speaker at investment conferences such as the RAISE Summit, where he discusses current trends in European venture capital and technology startups.

blocks.content: Publicly available information regarding Julien Bek's personal life is limited. Bek is based in London, United Kingdom, where he is part of Sequoia Capital's European investment team. His professional activities are focused on seed and early-stage technology investments, and he is noted for keeping his family and personal details private in public profiles and interviews. Bek is recognized for his international perspective, having worked and invested across several markets prior to joining Sequoia Capital. He occasionally participates in industry events and conferences as a speaker, including the RAISE Summit, but does not disclose personal information in these settings.

blocks.content: Julien Bek is a British venture capitalist and partner at Sequoia Capital, known for leading early-stage and seed investments in technology startups. Based in London, Bek has been instrumental in Sequoia's European expansion and is recognized for backing notable companies including AI, fintech, and enterprise software ventures. Before joining Sequoia, he held roles at Accel and has been featured on Forbes' influential investor lists. Bek is a frequent speaker at industry events such as the RAISE Summit, reflecting his prominence in the European venture capital landscape.
